title: Gross domestic product ( GDP ) growth rate in Mozambique 2024
yAxis: GDP growth compared to previous year
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing GDP growth compared to previous year, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2014.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2024 to 2022.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2022 to 2021.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2021 to 2020.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2020 to 2019.
gold: The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in Mozambique from 2014 to 2018 , with projections up until 2024 . In 2018 , Mozambique 's real gross domestic product increased by around 3.27 percent compared to the previous year .
